children.name: 2-PS1-1
children.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties.

children.name: 2-PS1-3
children.description: Make observations to construct an evidence-based account of how an object made of a small set of pieces can be disassembled and made into a new object.

children.name: 2-PS1-4
children.description: Construct an argument with evidence that some changes caused by heating or cooling can be reversed and some cannot.

children.name: 2-LS2-1
children.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to determine if plants need sunlight and water to grow.

children.name: 2-LS2-2
children.description: Develop a simple model that mimics the function of an animal in dispersing seeds or pollinating plants.

children.name: 2-LS4-1
children.description: Make observations of plants and animals to compare the diversity of life in different habitats.

children.name: 2-ESS1-1
children.description: Use information from several sources to provide evidence that Earth events can occur quickly or slowly.

children.name: 2-ESS2-1
children.description: Compare multiple solutions designed to slow or prevent wind or water from changing the shape of the land.

children.name: 2-ESS2-2
children.description: Develop a model to represent the shapes and kinds of land and bodies of water in an area.

children.name: The Roles of Water in Earth’s Surface Processes
2-ESS2-3
children.description: Obtain information to identify where water is found on Earth and that it can be solid or liquid.
